thread.title: Josh Hamilton hurts left knee for fourth time in two seasons
thread.title_full: Josh Hamilton hurts left knee for fourth time in two seasons

author: Dan Sostek (daniel.sostek@performgroup.com)
title: Josh Hamilton hurts left knee for fourth time in two seasons
text:
18am  18am EST Josh Hamilton has had surgery on his left knee three times in the past two seasons, and he tweaked it again Wednesday. Josh Hamilton  18  18 a.m. ET 
It's been a rough couple of years for Josh Hamilton. 
The former comeback success story, whose rebound from drug addict to MVP is in the process of being turned into a movie , suffered yet another injury setback Wednesday. 
MORE: MLB gets it wrong — again — with change to intentional walk rule 
Hamilton "tweaked his left knee," according to MLB.com's TR Sullivan . He will head back to Texas for further examination. 
The former All-Star has had surgery on that knee three times in the past two years, so news of another tweak can't be welcome. 
The Rangers were reportedly hoping to move Hamilton to first base after signing him to a minor league deal this offseason. 
If this injury to his knee is serious, it's fair to assume a fourth complication over such a short span could potentially put the 35-year-old's career in jeopardy. Watch This
